subclusters.subcluster_name: Sch9/Rim15/Msn2 Stress Resistance and Autophagy Hyperfunction Theory
Insulin-mTOR Hyperfunction and Lipid Regulation Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mTOR pathway as a central regulator of aging and lifespan modulation via rapamycin inhibition.
Describes mTOR hyperactivation driving cellular senescence and aging hallmarks, emphasizing mTOR as a causal aging regulator.
Details mTORC1 and mTORC2 roles in aging, linking mTOR signaling to multiple aging hallmarks and lifespan regulation.
Highlights mTOR hyperactivation post-development promoting aging and rapamycin’s lifespan extension effects.
Focuses on mTORC1 as a nutrient and hormonal signal integrator whose activation accelerates aging, with inhibition extending lifespan.
Describes TOR pathway as a conserved nutrient sensor regulating growth and aging, with inhibition extending lifespan.
Explains TOR pathway’s role in lifespan regulation and rapamycin-mediated lifespan extension, overlapping with caloric restriction.
Details mTOR’s regulation of cell growth and protein synthesis, with inhibition extending lifespan and ameliorating age-related diseases.
Focuses on mTOR-driven geroconversion causing cellular senescence and aging, with pan-mTOR inhibitors suppressing aging phenotypes.
Describes mTOR signaling’s role in aging and a midlife switch-off of longevity programs, with pharmacological modulation mimicking longevity.
Covers conserved IIS and mTOR pathways regulating metabolism and aging, with reduced signaling extending lifespan.
Describes mTOR inhibition and AMPK activation as core longevity pathways shared by longevity-enhancing compounds.
Focuses on mTORC1 inhibition by rapamycin inducing autophagy to extend lifespan and improve tissue health.
Describes mTORC1 regulation of histone expression and chromatin remodeling that epigenetically activates autophagy to promote longevity.
Focuses on mTOR inhibition improving proteostasis via autophagy, chaperones, and proteasome regulation, promoting healthy aging.
Describes mTOR’s regulation of mitochondrial homeostasis and retrograde signaling via p62/Keap1/NFE2L2 axis enhancing longevity.
Details mTOR-raptor complex’s direct regulation of mitochondrial oxidative metabolism and energy balance.
Describes TOR as energy sensor coordinating mitochondrial metabolism and lifespan via feedback loops.
Covers TOR’s conserved role in regulating aging and senescence via autophagy induction and metabolic control across kingdoms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Growth Signaling-Induced Replication Stress Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on growth signaling causing inappropriate S phase entry and replication stress leading to senescence and aging.
Describes aging as run-on of developmental/reproductive programs causing late-life pathologies via antagonistic pleiotropy.
Links faster growth to increased ROS generation and proinflammatory signaling accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Sch9/Rim15/Msn2 Stress Resistance and Autophagy Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes TORC1-Sch9-Rim15-Msn2 pathway regulating oxidative stress response and autophagy to modulate aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Sch9/Rim15/Msn2 Stress Resistance and Autophagy Hyperfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on Sch9/Rim15/Msn2 pathway promoting stress resistance and mitophagy to extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin-mTOR Hyperfunction and Lipid Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes insulin-mTOR hyperactivation driving aging, regulated by LPD-3 and sphingolipid pathways affecting mTORC2.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin-mTOR Hyperfunction and Lipid Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on insulin-mTOR hyperfunction causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging, modulated by LPD-3 and lipid metabolism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin-mTOR Hyperfunction and Lipid Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers IIS and TOR pathways regulating lifespan via FOXO, with cross-talk influencing aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR Complexes Balance in Reproductive Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes balance of mTORC1 and mTORC2 in Sertoli cells regulating sperm epigenetic aging and reproductive aging.
